intro: Jacea eriophora, commonly known as the narrowleaf jacea, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, grassy habitats and has slender, erect stems. Its leaves are narrow and linear, with a rough texture, and it produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. Jacea eriophora is often found in disturbed soils and can serve as an indicator of certain ecological conditions.
